statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Reginald Gee scored 20 points and Alabama State used a strong finish to beat Arkansas-Pine Bluff 77-65 and snap a two-game losing streak Saturday.
article.headline: Alabama State snaps skid, beats Arkansas-Pine Bluff, 77-65
article.linkText: Alabama State snaps skid, beats Arkansas-Pine Bluff, 77-65
article.story: MONTGOMERY, Ala. -- Reginald Gee scored 20 points and Alabama State used a strong finish to beat Arkansas-Pine Bluff 77-65 and snap a two-game losing streak Saturday. Arkansas-Pine Bluff cut the deficit to six points, 61-55, with four minutes remaining but Tony Armstrong answered with a layup and Torloft Thomas drilled a 3-pointer and added a free throw to push the lead to 12 points and Alabama State cruised home. The Hornets lost a pair of games on the road, losing by a field goal at Texas Southern and by 20 points at Prairie View A&M. Arkansas-Pine Bluff, which lost back-to-back games to Grambling State and Jackson State, now has lost six of its last seven games. Tony Armstrong added 17 points for Alabama State (6-16, 4-6), which shot 59.1 percent in the second half (13 of 22). Joe'Randle Toliver scored 18 points to lead the Golden Lions (5-19, 4-6).
